definitions.definition: the act of putting something inside something else; a thing that is put inside something else

examples.text: An examination is carried out before the insertion of the tube.
Acupuncture involves the insertion of needles into specific points of the body.

definitions.definition: a thing that is added to a book, piece of writing, etc.; the act of adding something

examples.text: the insertion of an extra paragraph

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. (in sense (2)): from late Latin insertio(n-), from Latin inserere, from in- ‘into’ + serere ‘to join’.
